# Budget Tracking App - Project Setup Instructions

## Project Overview
Next.js 14+ budget tracking application with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, and SQLite database.

## Setup Progress
- [x] Clarify Project Requirements - Budget tracking app with $350 monthly limit, recurring expenses, table/chart views
- [x] Scaffold the Project - Next.js project created with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and App Router
- [x] Customize the Project - All budget tracking features implemented
- [x] Install Required Extensions - All dependencies installed (shadcn/ui, better-sqlite3, recharts, etc.)
- [x] Compile the Project - Project compiled successfully
- [x] Create and Run Task - Development server running on http://localhost:3000
- [x] Launch the Project - Application launched and accessible
- [x] Ensure Documentation is Complete - README.md updated with complete documentation

## Project Features Implemented
✅ Monthly budget limit: $350
✅ Recurring expenses: Rent ($100), Internet ($50), College ($70)
✅ Table view (Notion-like) for expense management
✅ Chart view with tab switching (Bar and Pie charts)
✅ Add expense button/dialog with form validation
✅ Alert when budget limit is exceeded
✅ Database storage (SQLite/better-sqlite3)
✅ Dark mode support
✅ Responsive design
✅ API routes for CRUD operations

## How to Use
1. Run `npm run dev` to start the development server
2. Open http://localhost:3000 in your browser
3. The app comes pre-seeded with 3 recurring expenses
4. Click "Add Expense" to add manual expenses
5. Switch between Table and Chart views using tabs
6. Budget alerts appear automatically when limit is exceeded
